poles.name: Abstraction
poles.governs: The degree to which a work reduces specificity in favor of generalization or conceptual distance.
poles.function: Abstraction modulates how directly a work refers to the visible world. It describes distance from depiction, not meaning or depth.
activationConditions: Explicit reason stated for invoking this Pole
poles.failureMode: Abstraction is often treated as inherent value rather than a descriptive condition. Distance is mistaken for depth.

poles.name: Realism
poles.governs: The degree to which a work maintains specificity, depiction, or surface fidelity.
poles.function: Realism modulates how directly a work presents observable features. It describes closeness to depiction, not truth or sincerity.
activationConditions: Explicit reason stated for invoking this Pole
poles.failureMode: Realism is often treated as evidence of effort or truth, even when perception is not meaningfully guided.

mayNot: Function as proof of value or meaning

poles.name: Witness
poles.governs: The degree to which a work holds attention in unresolved presence rather than resolution.
poles.function: Witness modulates whether tension is sustained without correction. It describes refusal to resolve, not ethical stance.
activationConditions: Explicit reason stated for invoking this Pole
poles.failureMode: Witness is frequently inflated into ethical authority. Non-resolution is mistaken for depth or seriousness.

poles.name: Repair
poles.governs: The degree to which a work attempts restoration, correction, or resolution.
poles.function: Repair modulates whether a work moves toward closure or stabilization. It describes intent toward fixing, not success.
activationConditions: Explicit reason stated for invoking this Pole
poles.failureMode: Repair is often treated as virtue. Attempts at resolution are mistaken for ethical progress.

systemRules: Poles only modulate or constrain conclusions produced by Roots
Poles are accessed ONLY after at least 2 Roots have passed RAP
Poles can never be the first or primary explanation
